isis.stitle: 2 SPEED AND DOUBLE REDUCTION SINGLE DRIVE AXLES: EATON - ADJUST/INSTALL - ADJUST DIFFERENTIAL BEARING PRELOAD ( Figure 41 )

svcproc.title: ADJUST DIFFERENTIAL BEARING PRELOAD ( Figure 41)

figure.caption: Figure 41. Procedure Steps to Adjust Bearing Preload

svcproc.para: Correct differential bearing preload insures proper location of these bearings under load and helps position the ring gear for proper gear tooth contact.

step1.para: Lubricate differential bearings. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for recommended lubes.
Loosen the bearing adjuster on the same side as the ring gear teeth until its first thread is visible ( Figure 42).

Tighten the bearing adjuster on the back face side of the ring gear until there is no backlash. This can be tested by facing the ring gear teeth and pushing the gear away from the body while gently rocking the gear from side to side. There should be no free movement.

At teeth side of ring gear, tighten adjuster until it contacts the bearing cup. Continue tightening adjuster two or three notches and this will preload bearings and provide approximate backlash ( Figure 43).
